block.p: Nadia Holubnyczyj and Marco Vinicio Ortiz were married yesterday by the Rev. Barry Andrews, a Unitarian-Universalist minister, at the Swan Club in Glenwood Landing, N.Y.

Mrs. Holubnyczyj-Ortiz, 32, is a speech and language pathologist for PSCH Inc., a treatment center for mentally retarded people in Flushing, Queens. She graduated from Queens College, from which she also received a master's degree in speech and language pathology. She is a daughter of Helen Holubnyczyj of Bellerose, Queens.
Nadia Holubnyczyj and Marco Vinicio Ortiz were married yesterday by the Rev. Barry Andrews, a Unitarian-Universalist minister, at the Swan Club in Glenwood Landing, N.Y.

Mrs. Holubnyczyj-Ortiz, 32, is a speech and language pathologist for PSCH Inc., a treatment center for mentally retarded people in Flushing, Queens. She graduated from Queens College, from which she also received a master's degree in speech and language pathology. She is a daughter of Helen Holubnyczyj of Bellerose, Queens.

Mr. Ortiz, 29, is a communications engineer in computer network engineering at the New York Stock Exchange. He graduated from the Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art. He is a son of Zoila and Rigoberto Ortiz of Manhattan.
